Generate Patient-Level Expression Heatmap with Z-scores

Source: R/customized_vis.R
heatmap_pseudobulk.Rd

This function creates a heatmap showing gene expression z-scores aggregated at the patient level. Expression values are first averaged per patient within each cohort/timepoint, then z-score normalized across all samples.

heatmap_pseudobulk(
  object,
  features,
  groups,
  idents = NULL,
  pseudobulk_column = NULL,
  colors = NULL,
  cluster_rows = FALSE,
  cluster_columns = FALSE,
  show_column_names = FALSE,
  heatmap_title = "Z-score",
  color_range = c(-2, 0, 2),
  color_palette = c("#4575b4", "white", "#d73027"),
  annotation_height = unit(4, "mm")
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object containing expression data and metadata

features

Character vector of gene names to include in the heatmap

groups

Character vector specifying the order of cohort/timepoint groups. This defines both which groups to include and their display order.

idents

Character string specifying the metadata column containing cohort/timepoint information. If NULL, defaults to "cohort_tp".

pseudobulk_column

Character string specifying the metadata column containing pseudobulk. If NULL, defaults to "Patient".

colors

Named vector of colors for each cohort/timepoint group. Names must match the values in the idents If NULL, colors will be automatically generated from a standard palette.

cluster_rows

Logical indicating whether to cluster rows (genes). Default is FALSE.

cluster_columns

Logical indicating whether to cluster columns (samples). Default is FALSE.

show_column_names

Logical indicating whether to show sample names. Default is FALSE.

heatmap_title

Character string for the heatmap legend title. Default is "Z-score".

color_range

Numeric vector of length 3 specifying the values for (min, center, max) of the color scale. Default is c(-2, 0, 2).

color_palette

Character vector of length 3 specifying colors for (min, center, max). Default is c("#4575b4", "white", "#d73027").

annotation_height

Unit object specifying the height of the annotation bar. Default is unit(4, "mm").

Value

A ComplexHeatmap object

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Extracts normalized expression data for specified genes

  2. Averages expression per gene, per patient, per cohort/timepoint

  3. Computes z-scores across all samples for each gene (row-wise)

  4. Orders samples according to the specified group order

  5. Creates a heatmap with cohort annotations

Z-scores are calculated as: $$z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)$$ where x represents expression values across all samples for a given gene. NA values (from genes with constant expression) are replaced with 0.

If colors are not provided, the function automatically generates colors using a standard palette based on the unique values in the cohort column.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage with auto-generated colors
heatmap_pseudobulk(
  object = object,
  features = c("CD3D", "CD8A", "IFNG"),
  groups = c("Chronic Pre-DAA", "ACTG Pre-DAA", "SR Pre-resolution")
)

# With custom colors
my_colors <- c(
  "Chronic Pre-DAA" = "#F8A19FB2",
  "ACTG Pre-DAA" = "#2ED9FFB2",
  "SR Pre-resolution" = "#FEAF16B2"
)

heatmap_pseudobulk(
  object = object,
  features = marker_genes,
  groups = c("Chronic Pre-DAA", "ACTG Pre-DAA", "SR Pre-resolution"),
  colors = my_colors,
  cluster_rows = TRUE
)

# With custom metadata columns
heatmap_pseudobulk(
  object = object,
  features = marker_genes,
  groups = c("Group1", "Group2", "Group3"),
  idents = "treatment_group",
  pseudobulk_column = "sample_id"
)
} # }
